data: A lexical resource based on WordNet, which assigns sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to each word definition (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets, collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies to better recognize, interpret, and process opinions within this context.

Incorporates entity-sentiment annotation to address the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset, consisting of over 10,700 news headlines, provides insight into sentiment variations depending on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset of tokenized and annotated speeches of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC), meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. This resource aims to understand the influence of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

A dataset annotated with relationships within financial documents with approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, org-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from diverse news sources and analyzed by experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparison, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) within the financial landscape, assisting in the identification and classification of financial companies within text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with deep analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial questions.
